learning_outcomes.description: Explain how mutations and chromosomal abnormalities arise, and relate these to the pathogenesis of disease.
Apply the use of molecular markers in diagnostics and animal breeding, explain their underlying methodologies, and evaluate their strengths and limitations as a diagnostic tool.
Explain the screening and treatment options for genetic diseases and genetic technologies for animal improvement.
Design animal breeding plans for disease control and animal production, based on sound genetic principles.

assessments.task_description: Quiz 1 will be held in-person in Week 4 during the third scheduled lecture session timeslot (15 August, 2024; open from 1pm to 2pm). It will cover lecture content from weeks 1 - 4, inclusive. The quiz will include multiple choice and short answer questions. This quiz will be a 30-minute Inspera platform quiz.  The exam will incorporate a range of questions available in the Inspera examination platform.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The quiz will use the online Inspera platform. However, the quiz must be done in-person by students using their own personal devices. No Safe Exam Browser is necessary for the quiz. A login password will be provided during the scheduled quiz time by a member of course staff, which students will need to open the quiz in Inspera. The quiz will have a duration of 30 minutes. Inspera will show you a countdown timer. The summary page shows a ‘SUBMIT NOW’ button that students must click to submit their answers. After submission, students will receive a confirmation on the dashboard that they have submitted and can no longer edit responses.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: Quiz 2 will be held in-person in Week 8 during the first scheduled lecture session timeslot (09 September, 2024; open from 1pm to 2pm) and will cover the lecture and practical contents of weeks 5 - 7, inclusive. It will comprise a mix of multiple choice and short answer questions. This quiz will be a 30-minute Inspera platform quiz. The exam will incorporate a range of questions available in the Inspera examination platform.

assessments.task_description: The end of semester exam will cover the content of the lectures, practicals and tutorials of the whole semester. The exam will encompass short essay and problem-solving questions based on genetic disease case studies, genetic research scenarios and animal breeding goals. The exam will incorporate a range of questions available in the Inspera examination platform. This exam will be a 120-minute Inspera platform exam, with an additional 10 minutes planning time
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Genetic Fundamentals and Genetic Testing

This lecture series explores genetic fundamentals of inheritance and mutation in animals, and the principles and technologies for genetic testing and other applications.
learning_activities.topic_description: Genetic Fundamentals and Genetic Testing This lecture series explores genetic fundamentals of inheritance and mutation in animals, and the principles and technologies for genetic testing and other applications.

learning_activities.topic:
Genetic Testing Practical and Tutorials

Practical, self-directed learning and tutorial activities will provide an opportunity for students to explore the hands on laboratory techniques applicable to the isolation of genetic material and diagnosis of genetic diseases and the knowledge and skills to analyse their results.
learning_activities.topic_description: Genetic Testing Practical and Tutorials Practical, self-directed learning and tutorial activities will provide an opportunity for students to explore the hands on laboratory techniques applicable to the isolation of genetic material and diagnosis of genetic diseases and the knowledge and skills to analyse their results.

learning_activities.topic:
Genetic Diseases and Population Genetics

This lecture series introduces some of the applications of genetics in the study of genetic diseases. We will explore the genetic processes affecting populations, including wildlife populations, and the use of genetic markers in individuals and populations.
learning_activities.topic_description: Genetic Diseases and Population Genetics This lecture series introduces some of the applications of genetics in the study of genetic diseases. We will explore the genetic processes affecting populations, including wildlife populations, and the use of genetic markers in individuals and populations.

learning_activities.topic:
Population Genetics Tutorials

A series of small group tutorials and larger group calculation practice sessions will provide opportunities for students to apply lecture content to a diverse range of genetic disease and population scenarios.
learning_activities.topic_description: Population Genetics Tutorials A series of small group tutorials and larger group calculation practice sessions will provide opportunities for students to apply lecture content to a diverse range of genetic disease and population scenarios.

learning_activities.topic:
Animal Breeding Programs

This lecture series explores the principles of selective breeding to improve animal production and to reduce the incidence of genetic diseases.
learning_activities.topic_description: Animal Breeding Programs This lecture series explores the principles of selective breeding to improve animal production and to reduce the incidence of genetic diseases.
